meanings.definition: The straps or chains attached to a bridle by which a rider or driver controls a horse.
meanings.sent1: She held the reins tightly as she guided the horse along the trail.
meanings.sent2: The cowboy gently pulled on the reins to signal the horse to stop.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to use the reins to steer the bicycle.
meanings.sent4: In her hands, the reins of leadership felt heavy yet empowering.
meanings.sent5: The reins jingled softly as the horse trotted through the meadow.

meanings.definition: The power to direct and control.
meanings.sent1: The CEO has the reins of the company and makes important decisions.
meanings.sent2: With determination, she took the reins of her own destiny.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child pretended to have the reins of a magical kingdom.
meanings.sent4: As the team captain, he firmly grasped the reins of responsibility.
meanings.sent5: She felt the weight of the reins of authority settle on her shoulders.
